Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Pottery receptacle with decoration
Description: Cylindrical vase with straight walls and rim and a convex bottom, with beige-yellow coating. It has a painted decoration in black and reddish colours, consisting of four-petalled flowers organised into vertical bands which are bordered by vertical and horizontal lines encircling the piece below the rim and at the base.
